title: Multi-AI Code Engine - World's First 3-AI Coding System
preview: Telegram bot combines Gemini 3 + Kimi 2.5 + Claude 4.5. Import n8n workflow → Get ZIP files better than Cursor.
full: Complete n8n workflow JSON + optimized prompts for world's first multi-AI coding system: 1) Telegram Trigger (text/files), 2) Intent recognition AI Agent, 3) User project storage (Google Drive by user_id), 4) Gemini 3 Logic Planner (debug/planning), 5) Kimi 2.5 Code Generator (creative implementation), 6) Claude Sonnet 4.5 Final Polish (lint/format/validate), 7) Summary generator, 8) ZIP archive creation, 9) Telegram ZIP delivery with changelog. Pay-per-use APIs only ($0.03/request). No file limits, fully editable, beats Cursor Pro. Includes exact setup video script, API key configs, test cases. First 1000 sales @ $12.

title: Spotify Clone Pro: Production-Ready Music Streaming SaaS
preview: Complete Next.js 15 + Supabase Spotify clone with gapless streaming, AI recommendations, social features, and Stripe monetization.
full: Production-ready Spotify clone 'SoundWave Pro' – FULLSTACK music streaming platform that rivals Spotify Premium. Features: 1) Pixel-perfect responsive UI (mobile/desktop) with dark/light themes, 2) HTML5 gapless audio streaming + equalizer/lyrics/offline mode, 3) Complete features: search, playlists, queue mgmt, artist pages, recommendations, 4) Social: follow/share/activity feed, 5) Stripe subscriptions (Free/Pro tiers), 6) Enterprise backend (Prisma + Redis + tRPC), 7) PWA-ready with 1-click Vercel deploy. Includes 5K+ lines clean code, demo data (100+ tracks), DB schema, and full setup guide. Launch your $10K/mo music SaaS today.

title: Viral VEO3 Shorts Machine: Auto-Generate & Publish YouTube AI Videos Daily
preview: Complete n8n workflow that auto-generates viral YouTube Shorts with VEO3 AI video + GPT content creation.
full: Production-ready n8n automation that creates and publishes daily viral-style YouTube Shorts completely hands-free. Features: 1) Daily scheduled GPT-powered viral idea generation (web dev/AI/cybersecurity niches), 2) Structured VEO3 prompt engineering for cinematic 9:16 before/after transformation videos, 3) VEO3 API integration for automatic video rendering, 4) Google Sheets tracking (idea, caption, prompt details, status, YouTube URL), 5) Direct YouTube Shorts upload with optimized titles/captions/hashtags, 6) Full error handling and retry logic, 7) Production-ready workflow with detailed setup instructions. Perfect for creators scaling consistent short-form content. Download the complete n8n workflow JSON and import directly into your n8n instance.

title: Discord MT5 Trading Bot: Execute Forex Trades via Chat
preview: AI-powered Discord bot that executes MT5 forex trades from simple chat commands like 'buy EU market 2% sl 50'.
full: Production-ready n8n workflow transforms Discord into your live trading terminal. Features: 1) GPT-4o-mini AI classifies 6 command types instantly, 2) Regex + AI fallback parses flexible syntax (EU=EURUSD, GU=GBPUSD), 3) Market/limit orders routed to your MT5 broker via local webhooks, 4) Signal management (view/clear pending trades), 5) Real-time Discord feedback with confirmations/errors, 6) Risk management with % position sizing + SL/TP automation, 7) Mobile-ready - trade from Discord phone app, 8) Full error handling. Works with any MT5 broker account. Includes complete workflow JSON + setup guide. Perfect for hands-free forex execution.

title: Automate Blog Content Creation with GPT-4, Perplexity & WordPress
preview: Download a complete n8n workflow to automate blog content creation using GPT-4, Perplexity, and WordPress.
full: Complex multi-step n8n automation that fully automates blog content creation and publishing. This workflow orchestrates GPT-4 for content generation, Perplexity for research and fact-checking, and WordPress for automated publishing. It integrates with Notion for content planning, Lmchatopenai for AI processing, and Slack for real-time notifications and workflow monitoring. Built using 17 nodes and connected to 9 different services, this production-ready automation handles data processing, content structuring, and publishing with minimal human input. Download the complete n8n workflow JSON and import it directly into your n8n instance.

title: Build an Automated API Monitoring Script
preview: Create a script that monitors API uptime, logs errors, and sends alerts when issues are detected.
full: Write a production-ready Node.js script that monitors a REST API endpoint every 5 minutes. The script should log response time, status codes, and failures to a local JSON file. If the API fails more than 3 times consecutively, send an email alert using Nodemailer. Use clean async/await patterns, environment variables for configuration, and include detailed comments explaining each major step. Add graceful shutdown handling and comprehensive error logging.

title: Create a REST API with Express and MongoDB
preview: Build a complete RESTful API with authentication, CRUD operations, and MongoDB integration.
full: Create a production-ready Express.js REST API with the following features: 1) User authentication using JWT tokens, 2) CRUD endpoints for a 'products' resource with validation, 3) MongoDB integration using Mongoose with proper schema design, 4) Middleware for error handling and request logging, 5) Rate limiting to prevent abuse, 6) API documentation using Swagger/OpenAPI, 7) Environment-based configuration, 8) Comprehensive error responses with proper HTTP status codes. Include folder structure recommendations and security best practices.

title: Python Web Scraper with Error Handling
preview: Build a robust web scraper that handles pagination, retries, and exports data to CSV.
full: Write a Python web scraper using BeautifulSoup and Requests that: 1) Scrapes product data (title, price, rating, URL) from an e-commerce site, 2) Handles pagination automatically, 3) Implements exponential backoff retry logic for failed requests, 4) Respects robots.txt and includes user-agent rotation, 5) Saves data to CSV with proper encoding, 6) Logs progress and errors to a file, 7) Uses command-line arguments for URL and output file. Include detailed comments and exception handling for network errors, missing elements, and rate limiting.

Provide both frontend (React/vanilla JS) and backend (Node.js) code examples with environment configuration.

title: React Component Library Setup

full: Develop a complete real-time chat system with the following features: 1) WebSocket server using Socket.io with connection pooling and reconnection logic, 2) JWT-based authentication for socket connections with token refresh, 3) Private messaging and public chat rooms with join/leave events, 4) Typing indicators and user presence tracking (online/offline/away), 5) Message persistence using MongoDB with pagination and message history retrieval, 6) File sharing support for images and documents with size validation, 7) Message editing, deletion, and read receipts, 8) Rate limiting to prevent spam and abuse, 9) Admin controls for user management and moderation. Include both backend Socket.io server code and React frontend components with complete error handling and reconnection strategies.

title: Implement OAuth2 Social Login System
preview: Build a complete OAuth2 authentication system supporting Google, GitHub, and Facebook login with account linking.
full: Create a comprehensive OAuth2 authentication system that includes: 1) OAuth2 flow implementation for Google, GitHub, and Facebook using Passport.js strategies, 2) Account linking for users with multiple OAuth providers, 3) JWT token generation with access and refresh token rotation, 4) Email/password fallback authentication with bcrypt password hashing, 5) Email verification workflow with secure token generation, 6) Password reset functionality with time-limited tokens, 7) User profile merging when linking accounts, 8) Session management with Redis for scalability, 9) CSRF protection and secure cookie handling, 10) Rate limiting on authentication endpoints. Include complete Express.js backend with React frontend login forms, proper error handling, and security best practices following OWASP guidelines.

title: Build a GraphQL API with Subscriptions and DataLoader
preview: Create a production-ready GraphQL API with queries, mutations, real-time subscriptions, and optimized data fetching.
full: Develop a complete GraphQL API using Apollo Server that includes: 1) Schema design with proper type definitions, interfaces, and unions, 2) Query resolvers with pagination using cursor-based approach, 3) Mutation resolvers with input validation using Yup or Joi, 4) Real-time subscriptions using PubSub for live data updates, 5) DataLoader implementation to prevent N+1 query problems and batch database requests, 6) Authentication and authorization middleware with context-based user verification, 7) Custom directives for field-level permissions (@auth, @hasRole), 8) Error handling with custom error classes and error codes, 9) File upload handling for single and multiple files, 10) Rate limiting and query complexity analysis to prevent abuse, 11) PostgreSQL integration using Prisma or TypeORM with connection pooling, 12) GraphQL Playground configuration for development and testing. Include complete schema definition, resolver implementations, and subscription setup with Redis for production scalability.

title: Create a Microservices Architecture with Node.js

full: Build a complete microservices architecture that includes: 1) Multiple independent services (User Service, Product Service, Order Service, Notification Service) with clear domain boundaries, 2) API Gateway using Kong or Express Gateway for request routing, authentication, and rate limiting, 3) Service discovery using Consul or Kubernetes DNS for dynamic service registration, 4) Inter-service communication via REST APIs and message queues (RabbitMQ or Kafka), 5) Event-driven architecture with domain events for loose coupling, 6) Centralized logging with ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) for log aggregation, 7) Distributed tracing using Jaeger or Zipkin for request flow visualization, 8) Circuit breaker pattern using Hystrix or resilience4j for fault tolerance, 9) Database per service pattern with PostgreSQL and MongoDB, 10) Configuration management with environment-based configs and secret management, 11) Health checks and monitoring endpoints for each service, 12) Docker Compose setup for local development with hot-reload. Include complete folder structure, service templates, communication patterns, and deployment strategies for cloud environments.

title: Build an Advanced Caching Strategy with Redis
preview: Implement a production-grade caching system using Redis with cache invalidation, warming, and distributed locking.
full: Create a comprehensive caching solution that includes: 1) Redis connection setup with connection pooling and cluster support, 2) Multi-layer caching strategy (in-memory cache + Redis) with automatic fallback, 3) Cache-aside pattern implementation with lazy loading, 4) Write-through and write-behind caching patterns for different use cases, 5) Smart cache invalidation strategies (TTL, LRU, manual invalidation), 6) Cache warming on application startup for frequently accessed data, 7) Distributed locking using Redis for preventing cache stampede, 8) Cache key design patterns and namespace organization, 9) JSON serialization/deserialization with compression for large objects, 10) Pub/Sub pattern for cache synchronization across multiple instances, 11) Cache hit/miss ratio monitoring and analytics, 12) Cache versioning strategy for schema changes. Include middleware for Express.js, caching decorators for TypeScript, error handling for Redis connection failures, and performance benchmarking code. Add Redis configuration for production with persistence options (RDB/AOF).

full: Create a production-ready CI/CD pipeline that includes: 1) Git branching strategy (GitFlow or trunk-based) with protected branches and PR requirements, 2) GitHub Actions workflows for automated testing on every push and PR, 3) Linting and code formatting checks using ESLint, Prettier, and commitlint, 4) Unit testing with Jest and integration testing with Supertest, 5) Code coverage reporting with Codecov integration and minimum coverage thresholds, 6) Security vulnerability scanning using npm audit and Snyk, 7) Docker image building with multi-stage builds and layer caching, 8) Automated versioning using semantic-release based on conventional commits, 9) Deployment to multiple environments (dev, staging, production) with environment-specific configurations, 10) Automated rollback on deployment failures with health check validation, 11) Slack/Discord notifications for build status and deployment updates, 12) Database migration execution during deployment with rollback support, 13) Secrets management using GitHub Secrets and environment variables, 14) Performance testing integration with Lighthouse CI for frontend apps. Include complete .github/workflows YAML files, pre-commit hooks configuration, and deployment scripts for AWS, Vercel, or DigitalOcean.

Include complete handler functions, DynamoDB query patterns, deployment scripts, and monitoring dashboards setup.

title: Create an Advanced Search System with Elasticsearch
preview: Implement a production-grade full-text search engine with Elasticsearch, including faceted search, autocomplete, and relevance tuning.
full: Build a comprehensive search solution that includes: 1) Elasticsearch cluster setup with proper node roles (master, data, ingest), 2) Index design with custom analyzers, tokenizers, and filters for different languages, 3) Mapping configuration with proper field types, multi-fields, and nested objects, 4) Full-text search with fuzzy matching, phrase matching, and proximity queries, 5) Faceted search with aggregations for filtering by categories, price ranges, and tags, 6) Autocomplete and search-as-you-type functionality using edge n-grams, 7) Relevance tuning with custom scoring, boosting fields, and function score queries, 8) Synonym handling and stemming for better search recall, 9) Bulk indexing with batching and error handling, 10) Real-time index updates with refresh intervals optimization, 11) Search result highlighting for matched terms, 12) Pagination with scroll API for large result sets, 13) Query optimization and performance monitoring with slow log analysis, 14) Integration with Node.js using official Elasticsearch client. Include index templates, search query builders, aggregation examples, and performance benchmarking scripts.

full: Develop a complete video streaming backend that includes: 1) Video upload and processing pipeline using FFmpeg for transcoding, 2) Adaptive bitrate streaming (HLS/DASH) with multiple quality levels, 3) Video chunking and segmentation for optimal streaming performance, 4) CDN integration (CloudFront or Cloudflare) for global content delivery, 5) Signed URLs and token-based authentication for secure video access, 6) User progress tracking with resume playback functionality, 7) Real-time viewer analytics and watch time metrics, 8) Thumbnail generation at multiple timestamps, 9) Subtitle/caption support with WebVTT format, 10) DRM integration for premium content protection, 11) Concurrent stream limiting per user account, 12) Video metadata management (title, description, tags, categories), 13) Search functionality with Elasticsearch for video discovery, 14) Recommendation system based on watch history and user preferences, 15) S3/Cloud Storage integration for video file storage with lifecycle policies. Include complete upload handler, transcoding queue system using Bull or AWS MediaConvert, streaming endpoint configuration, and player integration examples for web and mobile.

full: Create a comprehensive rate limiting solution that includes: 1) Multiple rate limiting algorithms (Token Bucket, Leaky Bucket, Fixed Window, Sliding Window), 2) Redis-based distributed rate limiting for multi-instance deployments, 3) Per-user, per-IP, and per-endpoint rate limit configurations, 4) Tiered rate limits based on user subscription level (free/premium/enterprise), 5) Custom rate limit headers (X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset), 6) Graceful degradation when Redis is unavailable with in-memory fallback, 7) Rate limit bypass for whitelisted IPs and API keys, 8) Dynamic rate limit adjustment based on system load, 9) Rate limit analytics and monitoring dashboard, 10) Custom error responses with retry-after information, 11) Integration with Express.js middleware and Fastify decorators, 12) GraphQL query complexity-based rate limiting, 13) WebSocket connection rate limiting, 14) Automated testing for rate limit scenarios. Include complete middleware implementation, Redis Lua scripts for atomic operations, configuration examples, and load testing scripts to validate rate limiting under high traffic.

full: Music streaming app with: audio player, playlists, search, user library, recommendations, social features, artist pages, album views, queue management, and lyrics display.

Implement end-to-end encryption for all patient data, HIPAA-compliant audit trails, automatic session timeout, data backup and disaster recovery, PostgreSQL with row-level security, and detailed deployment documentation for HIPAA-compliant AWS infrastructure.

title: Create a Fleet Management System for Logistics
preview: Build a complete fleet tracking system with GPS, route optimization, and maintenance scheduling.
full: Develop a comprehensive fleet management platform using React, Node.js, PostgreSQL with PostGIS, and real-time GPS tracking. System features: 1) Real-time vehicle tracking with Google Maps integration showing all vehicles on map, 2) Geofencing with entry/exit alerts for designated zones, 3) Route optimization using Google Routes API for multi-stop delivery planning, 4) Driver assignment with shift management and availability tracking, 5) Fuel consumption monitoring with efficiency reports and anomaly detection, 6) Maintenance scheduling based on mileage/hours with service history tracking, 7) Vehicle inspection checklists with photo uploads and digital signatures, 8) Driver behavior monitoring including speeding, harsh braking, and idle time, 9) Trip history with playback feature showing vehicle path over time, 10) Delivery management with proof of delivery (POD) signatures and photos, 11) Customer portal for tracking shipments in real-time, 12) Automated ETA calculations and customer notifications, 13) Expense tracking for fuel, repairs, and tolls, 14) Driver mobile app for navigation, job acceptance, and status updates, 15) Vehicle health monitoring with diagnostic code integration (OBD-II), 16) Reporting dashboard with fleet utilization, cost per mile, and on-time delivery rates, 17) Integration with fuel cards for automated expense reconciliation, 18) Accident reporting workflow with insurance claim tracking, 19) Document management for vehicle registrations, licenses, and certifications, 20) Multi-company support for fleet operators managing multiple clients. Include PostGIS for geospatial queries, Redis for caching vehicle positions, Socket.io for real-time updates, background jobs for route calculations, comprehensive testing, mobile app built with React Native, and deployment guide for AWS with RDS and ElastiCache.

title: Build a Learning Management System (LMS) Like Udemy
preview: Create a complete online course platform with video hosting, quizzes, certificates, and payment processing.
full: Develop a full-featured learning management system using Next.js, Node.js, PostgreSQL, and AWS S3/CloudFront. Platform features: 1) Instructor onboarding with profile creation, bio, and credentials verification, 2) Course creation wizard with curriculum builder supporting sections and lectures, 3) Video upload and processing with HLS transcoding for adaptive streaming, 4) Rich text editor for lesson content with code syntax highlighting, 5) Quiz builder with multiple choice, true/false, and fill-in-the-blank questions, 6) Assignment submission with file uploads and instructor grading, 7) Course pricing with one-time purchase or subscription options via Stripe, 8) Coupon and discount code system with usage limits and expiration, 9) Student dashboard with enrolled courses, progress tracking, and bookmarks, 10) Video player with speed control, closed captions, and note-taking, 11) Discussion forum per course with Q&A and peer interaction, 12) Certificate generation upon course completion with unique verification codes, 13) Instructor analytics showing revenue, enrollment trends, and student engagement, 14) Review and rating system with verified student badges, 15) Course search with filters by category, level, rating, and language, 16) Wishlist and cart functionality with saved payment methods, 17) Mobile app for offline video downloads and learning on-the-go, 18) Live class integration with Zoom or WebRTC for real-time instruction, 19) Affiliate marketing program with commission tracking, 20) Admin panel for course approval, content moderation, and payout management. Use FFmpeg for video processing, PostgreSQL for data, Redis for caching, Bull for encoding jobs, Socket.io for live chat, comprehensive testing with Jest, SEO optimization, and deployment guide for Vercel with AWS media pipeline.

title: Create a Restaurant Chain Management Platform
preview: Build a multi-location restaurant management system with inventory, menu, staff, and sales tracking.
full: Build a comprehensive restaurant chain management platform using React, Node.js, PostgreSQL, and real-time synchronization. System capabilities: 1) Multi-location management with centralized control and individual location autonomy, 2) Menu management with items, modifiers, pricing, and nutritional information, 3) Point of Sale (POS) integration with order taking, table management, and payment processing, 4) Inventory tracking across all locations with automated reorder points, 5) Supplier management with purchase orders and invoice reconciliation, 6) Recipe costing with ingredient quantities and waste calculation, 7) Employee scheduling with shift templates, time-off requests, and labor cost tracking, 8) Time clock system with biometric or PIN entry and overtime calculation, 9) Kitchen display system (KDS) with order routing and preparation timing, 10) Customer relationship management with loyalty program and birthday tracking, 11) Online ordering integration with delivery platform APIs (DoorDash, UberEats), 12) Reservation management with table assignment and waitlist, 13) Sales reporting with daily summaries, category breakdowns, and trend analysis, 14) Food safety compliance with temperature logs and HACCP checklist, 15) Vendor portal for invoice submission and payment status, 16) Franchise management with royalty calculations and performance benchmarking, 17) Mobile app for managers to monitor sales and approve requests remotely, 18) Marketing campaign management with promotions and email distribution, 19) Accounting integration for journal entries and financial reporting, 20) Multi-currency support for international locations. Include offline mode for POS resilience, real-time data sync across locations, automated backup system, role-based access control with location restrictions, comprehensive reporting with Power BI integration, and deployment architecture for high availability with load balancing.

title: Build a Construction Project Management Platform
preview: Create a construction management system with project tracking, bidding, RFIs, and budget management.
full: Develop a construction project management platform using React, Node.js, PostgreSQL, and document management. Platform features: 1) Project setup with site address, owner information, and contract details, 2) Bidding system with RFQ distribution, bid comparison, and vendor selection, 3) Subcontractor management with insurance tracking and license verification, 4) Blueprint and drawing management with version control and markup tools, 5) RFI (Request for Information) workflow with response tracking and approval chain, 6) Submittal management for material approvals with review cycles, 7) Change order processing with cost impact and schedule implications, 8) Daily log entries with weather, labor, equipment, and progress notes, 9) Progress photo documentation with before/after comparisons and 360° tours, 10) Budget tracking with committed costs, actual costs, and forecasting, 11) Schedule management with Gantt charts and critical path analysis, 12) Material tracking with purchase orders, delivery schedules, and on-site inventory, 13) Time and attendance for field workers with geofencing verification, 14) Safety incident reporting with OSHA compliance and corrective actions, 15) Quality control with punch lists, inspections, and deficiency tracking, 16) Document library with contracts, permits, certifications, and warranties, 17) Mobile app for field teams with offline capability and photo upload, 18) Client portal for owner access to reports, photos, and invoices, 19) Payment application workflow with progress billing and lien waivers, 20) Closeout documentation with as-built drawings and equipment manuals. Use PostgreSQL with JSONB for flexible document storage, S3 for file storage with expiring signed URLs, Redis for caching, Socket.io for real-time updates, comprehensive API documentation, mobile app with React Native, and deployment guide for AWS with multi-region backup.

title: Create a Social Fitness Challenge Platform
preview: Build a fitness app with challenges, leaderboards, activity tracking, and social competition.
full: Build a comprehensive social fitness platform using React Native, Node.js, PostgreSQL, and health data APIs. Application features: 1) User profiles with photos, bio, fitness goals, and achievement badges, 2) Challenge creation with custom rules (steps, distance, calories, workouts), 3) Challenge types: individual goals, head-to-head competitions, and team events, 4) Activity tracking integration with Apple Health, Google Fit, Fitbit, and Strava, 5) Manual activity logging for workouts not captured by wearables, 6) Real-time leaderboards with filtering by friends, location, and age group, 7) Social feed with workout posts, photos, and encouragement comments, 8) Achievement system with badges for milestones and streaks, 9) Friend system with following, followers, and workout notifications, 10) In-app messaging for trash talk and motivation, 11) Challenge betting with entry fees and winner payouts via Stripe, 12) Team formation with captains, rosters, and aggregate scoring, 13) Workout library with video demonstrations and rep tracking, 14) Nutrition logging with calorie counting and macro tracking, 15) Progress photos with side-by-side comparisons and timeline view, 16) Wearable device integration for heart rate and sleep tracking, 17) Custom workout plans with progression and rest days, 18) Virtual races with GPS tracking and route visualization, 19) Corporate wellness integration for company challenges, 20) Analytics dashboard showing trends, correlations, and insights. Include push notifications for challenge updates, data synchronization across devices, offline mode for workouts, social sharing to Instagram/Twitter, comprehensive testing, privacy controls for activity visibility, and deployment guide for production with MongoDB Atlas and AWS Lambda for data processing.

title: n8n Workflow: Automated Lead Generation & CRM Sync
preview: Create an n8n automation that scrapes LinkedIn, enriches contacts, and syncs to your CRM with follow-up emails.
full: Build a complete lead generation workflow in n8n with the following nodes and logic: 1) LinkedIn Sales Navigator scraper using Apify API to extract profiles matching search criteria (job titles, industries, locations), 2) HTTP Request to Clearbit Enrichment API for additional company data (revenue, employee count, tech stack), 3) Hunter.io integration to find email addresses with verification, 4) Email validation using NeverBounce API to ensure deliverability, 5) IF node to filter leads based on company size (>50 employees) and revenue (>$1M), 6) HubSpot CRM integration to create or update contact records, 7) Set custom properties in HubSpot (lead source, enrichment date, validation status), 8) Slack notification to sales team with new qualified lead details, 9) Gmail integration to send personalized outreach email using template variables, 10) Airtable database to log all enrichment attempts and success rates, 11) Schedule trigger to run workflow daily at 9 AM, 12) Error handling with retry logic and fallback to manual review queue, 13) Google Sheets integration for weekly summary report of leads generated, 14) Webhook endpoint to manually trigger workflow from external tools. Configuration: Set up credentials for LinkedIn (via Apify), Clearbit, Hunter.io, NeverBounce, HubSpot, Slack, Gmail, and Airtable. Use JavaScript code nodes for data transformation, templating for email personalization, and conditional routing based on enrichment success. Include rate limiting to respect API quotas, deduplication logic to prevent duplicate contacts, and comprehensive error logging. Export workflow as JSON with detailed node descriptions and setup instructions.

title: n8n Workflow: E-commerce Order Processing & Fulfillment
preview: Automate order processing from Shopify to ShipStation with inventory updates and customer notifications.
full: Create a comprehensive e-commerce automation workflow in n8n: 1) Shopify Webhook trigger for new orders with order details, customer info, and line items, 2) IF node to check if order is flagged for fraud review or payment pending, 3) HTTP Request to ShipStation API to create shipment with order details and shipping method, 4) Inventory update in Google Sheets or Airtable to decrement stock quantities, 5) IF node to check inventory levels and trigger reorder if below threshold, 6) Email to supplier for automatic reorder using Gmail with PO template, 7) Slack notification to warehouse team with picking list and special instructions, 8) Delay node waiting for shipment confirmation from ShipStation, 9) ShipStation Webhook for tracking number availability, 10) Shopify API call to update order with fulfillment status and tracking info, 11) SendGrid or Mailchimp email to customer with shipping confirmation and tracking link, 12) SMS notification via Twilio for high-value orders (>$500), 13) Google Analytics event tracking for conversion and revenue attribution, 14) Airtable database to log all orders with processing timestamps, 15) Daily summary report via email with orders processed, revenue, and pending issues, 16) Error handling for API failures with retry logic and admin alerts, 17) Integration with QuickBooks for automatic invoice creation and accounting sync. Setup includes webhooks for Shopify and ShipStation, API credentials for all services, email templates for customer communications, and conditional logic for order types (standard, expedited, international). Include comprehensive error handling, data validation, and rate limiting. Export as documented JSON workflow.

title: n8n Workflow: Social Media Content Scheduler & Analytics
preview: Automate content posting to Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, and Facebook with scheduling and analytics tracking.
full: Build a complete social media automation workflow in n8n: 1) Google Sheets or Airtable as content calendar with columns for post text, images, scheduled time, platforms, and hashtags, 2) Schedule trigger running every 15 minutes to check for posts due for publishing, 3) IF conditions to route posts to appropriate platform APIs based on selection, 4) Twitter API integration to post tweets with media attachments and handle threading, 5) LinkedIn API to create posts on personal profile or company page with document attachments, 6) Instagram Graph API for feed posts and stories (requires Facebook Business account), 7) Facebook Graph API for page posts with link previews and tags, 8) Pinterest API for creating pins with images and destination URLs, 9) Image optimization using Cloudinary API for proper dimensions per platform, 10) Hashtag generation using ChatGPT or Claude API based on post content, 11) URL shortening with Bitly API for tracking click-through rates, 12) Post status update in content calendar marking as published with timestamp, 13) Analytics aggregation using platform APIs to fetch engagement metrics (likes, comments, shares, clicks), 14) Google Sheets logging of performance data for each post with engagement rates, 15) Weekly report generation with top-performing posts and audience insights, 16) Slack notification for posts that exceed engagement thresholds or go viral, 17) Error handling for API rate limits with queue system and retry logic, 18) Backup posting via webhooks if primary API fails. Configuration requires OAuth credentials for all social platforms, API keys for supporting services, template system for platform-specific formatting, and scheduling logic respecting timezone differences. Include data transformation for platform-specific requirements, media handling with fallbacks, and comprehensive logging. Export with setup guide and credential requirements.

title: n8n Workflow: Customer Support Ticket Automation
preview: Automate support ticket routing, categorization, and response using AI with multi-channel integration.
full: Create an intelligent customer support automation workflow in n8n: 1) Email trigger for incoming support emails to support@yourdomain.com, 2) Zendesk or Freshdesk webhook for tickets created through help center, 3) Slack webhook for support requests from company Slack channel, 4) WhatsApp Business API integration for messages from customers, 5) OpenAI GPT-4 API call to analyze ticket content and extract: issue category, urgency level, customer sentiment, and product/service affected, 6) IF node routing based on urgency: critical → immediate alert, high → priority queue, medium/low → standard queue, 7) Automatic ticket categorization in helpdesk (billing, technical, feature request, bug report), 8) Assignment to appropriate team/agent based on category and current workload, 9) Knowledge base search using Elasticsearch or Algolia to find relevant help articles, 10) Auto-response email with acknowledgment and relevant help articles using AI-generated summary, 11) If sentiment is negative, escalate to manager with Slack notification, 12) Create internal task in Asana or Linear for engineering team if bug is detected, 13) CRM lookup in HubSpot or Salesforce to check customer tier and account history, 14) SLA monitoring with deadline calculation based on customer tier, 15) Reminder system using schedule trigger to notify agents of approaching SLA deadlines, 16) CSAT survey via email 24 hours after ticket closure using Typeform or Google Forms, 17) Analytics collection in Google Sheets: ticket volume, resolution time, category distribution, agent performance, 18) Daily summary report to support manager with key metrics and outliers, 19) Integration with Jira for product team visibility on feature requests and bugs, 20) Escalation workflow for tickets unresolved after 48 hours. Setup requires API credentials for all platforms, GPT-4 API key with proper prompting for categorization, webhook configurations, email server setup, and comprehensive error handling with fallback to manual processing. Export with detailed setup instructions and customization guide.

title: n8n Workflow: Automated Invoice Generation & Payment Tracking
preview: Create invoices from project data, send to clients, track payments, and sync with accounting software.
full: Build a complete invoicing automation workflow in n8n: 1) Schedule trigger on last day of month to process all billable projects, 2) Airtable or Google Sheets query for active projects with hourly rates and logged time, 3) HTTP Request to time tracking API (Toggl, Harvest, Clockify) to get time entries for the month, 4) JavaScript code node to calculate totals: hours × rate, apply discounts, add expenses, calculate tax, 5) Stripe API to create invoice with line items, due date, and customer details, 6) Alternative path using PayPal Invoicing API for non-Stripe clients, 7) PDF generation using Puppeteer or PDFMonkey with company branding and invoice template, 8) Google Drive upload of invoice PDF to client folder with organized structure (YYYY/MM/), 9) Gmail or SendGrid email to client with invoice PDF attachment and payment link, 10) Calendar event creation for payment due date with reminder notifications, 11) Slack notification to finance team with invoice summary and client details, 12) Update project status in project management tool (Asana, Monday.com) to mark as invoiced, 13) QuickBooks or Xero integration to create invoice record in accounting software, 14) Stripe webhook listener for payment confirmation events, 15) Upon payment: Update invoice status in all systems (Airtable, QuickBooks, project tool), 16) Send payment confirmation email with receipt to client, 17) Slack notification to team celebrating payment received with confetti emoji, 18) Update client record in CRM with payment history and account status, 19) Automated reminder emails for overdue invoices at 7, 14, and 30 days past due, 20) Monthly reconciliation report comparing invoiced amounts vs received payments. Include error handling for missing time entries, duplicate invoice prevention, multi-currency support with conversion rates from API, tax calculation based on client location, and comprehensive logging. Configuration requires API credentials for time tracking, payment processors, email service, accounting software, and proper invoice template with company details. Export with setup documentation and customization options.

title: n8n Workflow: Real Estate Property Alert System
preview: Scrape property listings, filter by criteria, enrich with market data, and send instant alerts to investors.
full: Create a comprehensive property alert automation in n8n: 1) Schedule trigger running every 2 hours to check for new listings, 2) HTTP Request to Zillow API (or scraper for Realtor.com, Redfin) to fetch new properties in target zip codes, 3) Filter node to match investor criteria: price range ($100k-$500k), property type (single family, multi-family), bedrooms (3+), square footage (>1200), 4) Deduplicate against MongoDB or Airtable database of previously seen listings, 5) Attom Data API call for property details: year built, lot size, tax assessment, 6) Rentometer API to get average rent for the area based on bedrooms and location, 7) Walk Score API for walkability, transit, and bike scores, 8) JavaScript node to calculate investment metrics: estimated monthly rent - (mortgage + taxes + insurance + maintenance) = cash flow, 9) Cap rate calculation: (annual rent - operating expenses) / purchase price, 10) IF node to filter properties meeting minimum criteria (cap rate >8%, cash flow >$200/month), 11) Zillow historical data API for price trends and days on market, 12) Crime data API (CrimeReports.com) for neighborhood safety score, 13) School district rating from GreatSchools API, 14) Google Maps API for distance to key locations (downtown, highway, shopping), 15) Property photos download and upload to Google Drive in organized folders, 16) Create detailed property report as PDF with all metrics and photos, 17) Gmail or SendGrid email to investor with property summary and link to full report, 18) SMS via Twilio for high-priority deals meeting all criteria, 19) Add property to Airtable with all enriched data for deal tracking, 20) Slack notification to investment team with quick stats and MLS link. Advanced features: Integration with mortgage calculator API for different down payment scenarios, webhook for manual property submissions from investors, ML model integration for property value prediction, and comparative market analysis (CMA) generation. Setup requires API keys for all data sources, investor criteria configuration in environment variables, email templates, and database schema. Include error handling, rate limiting, and cost tracking for API usage. Export with comprehensive setup guide.

title: n8n Workflow: HR Onboarding Automation System
preview: Automate employee onboarding with account creation, equipment ordering, training assignment, and documentation.
full: Build a complete HR onboarding workflow in n8n: 1) Typeform or Google Forms submission trigger when HR submits new hire details, 2) Airtable or Google Sheets database entry creation with employee information (name, role, department, start date, manager), 3) Slack API to create new user account with proper display name and profile photo, 4) Google Workspace Admin API to create email account (firstname.lastname@company.com) with appropriate groups and permissions, 5) Microsoft 365 (if applicable) to create Azure AD account and assign licenses, 6) GitHub/GitLab API to create developer account with team repository access (for engineering hires), 7) Okta or OneLogin API to provision SSO access to all company applications, 8) Email to IT department with equipment request (laptop model, monitor, peripherals) based on role, 9) Integration with inventory management system (Airtable) to reserve equipment and update stock, 10) BambooHR or Workday API to create employee record with compensation, benefits, and personal details, 11) DocuSign API to send employment contract, NDA, and tax forms for e-signature, 12) Slack welcome message to #new-hires channel with introduction and onboarding checklist, 13) Asana or Monday.com task creation for manager: schedule 1-on-1, assign mentor, prepare workspace, 14) Learning management system (LMS) API to enroll in required training courses (security, compliance, company culture), 15) Calendar invitation for first day orientation and team introductions, 16) Generate employee handbook PDF personalized with employee details and send via email, 17) Notion or Confluence page creation with personalized onboarding guide and helpful links, 18) Slack bot DM to new hire on day before start date with logistics and what to expect, 19) Day 1 automated welcome email from CEO with video message and company swag info, 20) 30/60/90 day check-in reminders to manager via Slack with review templates. Include error handling for API failures, rollback procedures for account creation, security audit logging, and escalation to HR for manual intervention when needed. Setup requires admin API credentials for all platforms, onboarding templates, role-based configuration for department-specific steps, and integration testing. Export with setup documentation and customization guide for different employee types.

title: n8n Workflow: Automated Podcast Publishing Pipeline
preview: Process podcast audio, generate transcripts, create show notes, distribute to platforms, and promote on social media.
full: Create a complete podcast automation workflow in n8n: 1) Google Drive or Dropbox webhook trigger when new audio file is uploaded to 'Raw Episodes' folder, 2) Move file to processing folder to prevent duplicate triggers, 3) AssemblyAI or Rev.ai API call for audio transcription with speaker diarization, 4) OpenAI GPT-4 processing of transcript to generate: episode title, description, key points, timestamps, guest bio, chapter markers, 5) Keyword extraction for SEO optimization and topic categorization, 6) Auphonic or Cloudinary API for audio normalization, noise reduction, and loudness standardization, 7) ID3 tag writing with episode metadata (title, artwork, description, keywords), 8) Upload processed audio to podcast hosting (Libsyn, Transistor, Buzzsprout) via API, 9) Episode artwork generation using Canva API or Bannerbear with episode number and guest name, 10) Automatic RSS feed update with new episode details, 11) WordPress blog post creation with embedded player, transcript, and show notes, 12) YouTube upload as video podcast with static image and audio using YouTube Data API, 13) Spotify for Podcasters submission via API for faster indexing, 14) Audiogram creation using Headliner or Wavve API for social media clips (30-60 seconds), 15) Twitter thread posting with episode highlights and link using Twitter API, 16) LinkedIn article publication with extended show notes and professional insights, 17) Instagram carousel post with episode quotes and call-to-action, 18) Newsletter segment in Substack or ConvertKit featuring new episode, 19) Analytics tracking in Google Sheets: publish date, platforms, download metrics (via hosting API), 20) Listener engagement monitoring using Chartable or Podtrac with weekly reports. Advanced features: Guest notification email with publish confirmation and social share links, clip recommendations based on transcript highlights, automated Apple Podcasts/Spotify submission for new shows, and performance comparison across episodes. Setup requires API credentials for transcription service, hosting platform, content management, social media accounts, and comprehensive error handling for upload failures. Include audio quality validation, metadata templates, and rollback procedures. Export with detailed setup guide and customization options.

title: n8n Workflow: Competitor Monitoring & Alert System
preview: Track competitor websites for changes, monitor pricing, scrape social media, and alert your team to strategic moves.
full: Build a comprehensive competitor intelligence workflow in n8n: 1) Schedule trigger running daily at 8 AM to begin monitoring routine, 2) HTTP Request to competitor website homepage to fetch current content, 3) HTML Extract node to parse specific elements: prices, product names, promotional banners, featured content, 4) Compare current data with previous scrape stored in MongoDB or Airtable using code node, 5) Detect changes: new products, price increases/decreases, removed items, site redesign, 6) Screenshot capture using Puppeteer or ScreenshotAPI of competitor pages for visual reference, 7) Twitter API monitoring competitor's official accounts for new tweets and announcements, 8) LinkedIn API tracking competitor job postings (hiring patterns indicate business growth), 9) Google News API alerts for mentions of competitor in news articles, 10) Crunchbase API to track funding announcements and leadership changes, 11) SEMrush or Ahrefs API for competitor keyword rankings and backlink analysis, 12) SimilarWeb API for traffic estimates and referral sources, 13) Product Hunt API monitoring for new product launches, 14) GitHub API tracking competitor's open-source repositories for tech stack insights, 15) IF node to categorize changes by severity (critical: major price drop, high: new product, medium: blog post, low: minor copy change), 16) Slack notification to strategy team with change summary and impact assessment, 17) Email digest to leadership team with weekly competitive landscape report, 18) Airtable database update with all findings, timestamps, and competitive intelligence tags, 19) Google Sheets append for historical trend analysis and visualization, 20) Notion page update with competitive analysis dashboard and strategic implications. Advanced features: Sentiment analysis on competitor reviews using OpenAI, patent filing monitoring through USPTO API, social media engagement metrics (likes, shares, comments) tracking, and custom alert thresholds per competitor. Setup requires API credentials for social media platforms, web scraping tools, analytics services, and proper rate limiting to respect API quotas. Include proxy rotation for web scraping, deduplication logic, and escalation rules for significant changes. Export with setup documentation, legal compliance notes, and customization options for different industries.

title: n8n Workflow: Automated Expense Report Processing
preview: Extract receipt data using OCR, categorize expenses, verify policy compliance, and sync to accounting systems.
full: Create a complete expense management automation in n8n: 1) Email trigger for employees forwarding receipts to expenses@company.com, 2) Extract email attachments (images, PDFs) using built-in email parser, 3) Google Cloud Vision or AWS Textract OCR to extract text from receipt images, 4) OpenAI GPT-4 to parse extracted text and identify: merchant name, date, amount, tax, payment method, line items, 5) Categorization into expense types (meals, travel, office supplies, client entertainment, software) using AI classification, 6) Policy compliance check: amount limits per category (meals <$50, office supplies <$100), required fields validation, receipt age (<90 days), 7) Currency conversion for international receipts using Exchange Rate API, 8) IF node for policy violations: flag for manager review and request additional documentation, 9) Employee lookup in HR system (BambooHR, Workday) to get department, cost center, and approval hierarchy, 10) Expense record creation in Expensify, Concur, or Rydoo via API with all extracted details, 11) Google Drive upload of receipt image to employee folder with organized structure (YYYY/MM/), 12) Manager approval workflow via Slack with approve/reject buttons and expense summary, 13) If rejected: automated email to employee with reason and next steps, 14) If approved: Sync to accounting software (QuickBooks, Xero, NetSuite) with proper GL coding, 15) Payment processing via bank transfer API or adding to next payroll cycle, 16) Employee notification email with reimbursement confirmation and payment date, 17) Monthly expense report generation per employee with category breakdowns and trends, 18) Department-level analytics aggregation for budget tracking and variance analysis, 19) Tax-deductible expense flagging for year-end reporting, 20) Compliance audit trail logging all approvals and changes with timestamps. Advanced features: Mileage calculation using Google Maps API for travel expenses, duplicate receipt detection using image similarity algorithms, suspicious pattern detection (frequent high amounts, same merchant), and automated reminders for missing receipts. Setup requires OCR service API keys, email server configuration, accounting system integration, approval workflow customization, and comprehensive error handling. Include data validation, fraud prevention rules, and rollback capabilities. Export with setup guide and policy configuration templates.
